report_title: Cough & Cold Medicine Manufacturing OTC in the US
executive_summary: Companies in the Cough and Cold Medicine Manufacturing OTC industry have benefited from increasing consumers purchasing over-the-counter (OTC) medications to address ailments with at-home treatments. The COVID-19 pandemic has been the most prominent proponent for industry demand. In 2020 industry revenue increased as consumers stockpiled industry products to address symptoms and potential infection with the fear of a new COVID-19 variant.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Shift to OTC Medications Boosts Industry Revenue
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Increasing numbers of individuals choose over-the-counter (OTC) medicines over prescription drugs. This trend has been influenced by the high prevalence of colds, with the United States recording approximately 1.0 billion common cold cases annually.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Pandemic Spurs Demand for OTC Cough and Cold Medicines
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The COVID-19 pandemic, with symptoms similar to the common cold or flu, has driven consumers towards using OTC cough and cold medicines. This increased demand during the pandemic has led to a spike in industry revenue and profit.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Economic Fallout Drives Price-Sensitive Consumers to OTC Products
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The economic instability and unemployment caused by the pandemic have constricted national income. This economic constraint has driven demand for less expensive OTC products among price-sensitive consumers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: COVID-19 Mimics Previous Epidemics, Boosting Demand for OTC Products
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The pandemic has resulted in similar demand trends as seen during the H1N1 epidemic. With both viruses showing similar respiratory symptoms, the industry has benefited from the increased use of OTC medicines to mitigate these symptoms.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Demographic and Consumer Trends Influence Product Demand
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Populations highly vulnerable to colds or flu, like young children, drive demand for industry products. The Food and Drug Administration's decision to convert certain prescription drugs to OTC medications has also influenced industry revenue growth.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Competition on the Rise in the Cough and Cold Medicine Industry
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The industry contends with increased competition from pharmacies and drug stores offering private-label OTC medications. Foreign manufacturers are also intensifying competition, affecting export growth and domestic sales.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Growing Market: Demand for OTC Cough and Cold Medication Rises
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Increased accessibility and affordability of industry products are expected to boost demand for OTC cough and cold medicines. Healthcare professionals are expected to continue suggesting OTC medications over-prescribed antibiotics, creating more demand for these products. As the population ages, especially the Baby Boomer demographic, demand for cough and cold medication is anticipated to remain steady.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Demand Expected to Taper After Peak COVID-19 Period
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Although the pandemic has driven substantial increases in cough and cold medication demand, it will eventually revert to historical averages. The future widespread adoption of vaccines will impact demand for these products negatively.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: International Influence: Increased Import Penetration and Growth in Exports
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The growing import penetration from other countries might decrease demand for domestically produced medicines. Industry exports will increase due to untapped markets in developing countries, contributing to industry growth.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Healthcare Savings and Preference for Self-Treatment
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: OTC medicines are used extensively for self-treating minor illnesses, proving cost-effective for the healthcare sector. Healthcare providers will continue recommending OTC medicines for minor ailments, keeping demand for these products steady.

industry_definition: This industry manufactures over-the-counter (OTC) cough and cold treatments and suppressants. Products include systemic remedies, such as antihistamines and combination products, decongestants and medicated candies. The industry does not include companies that are primarily retailers, such as pharmacies or department stores.

positive_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: high - steady

opportunities: Demand from pharmacies and drug stores

market_segmentation.segment_description: Drug stores contribute significantly to industry revenue but face competition from private-label products.
Major retailers offering an expanding range of healthcare products, targeting baby boomers.
Stable demand for OTC products, but mergers with drug stores are shifting them to big box category.
Independent stores selling natural OTC products, facing competition from big box and hybrid stores.
Online retail has seen steady growth, accelerated by the pandemic, offering a promising platform.

products_and_services.product_description: Pressed powder medications and capsules with powdered drugs.
Consumable products dissolved before use, popular for children.
Decongestant nasal sprays and drops to reduce swelling.
Lozenges and drops for soothing throat irritation.

tier_1_suppliers: Plastic & Resin Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Organic Chemical Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Demand for cough and cold medicines tends to increase during the winter flu season.
An aging population, particularly baby boomers, drives demand for over-the-counter medications.
Growing health awareness influences consumer preferences for natural and organic remedies.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Imports of OTC cough and cold medicines surged during the COVID-19 pandemic as retailers stocked up.
Supply chain disruptions slowed imports as goods remained on docks longer than usual.
Developing nations are potential drivers for future export growth as healthcare systems improve.

business_locations.location_description: The Great Lakes region includes states surrounding the Great Lakes in the northern United States.
The Mid-Atlantic region includes states in the northeastern United States along the Atlantic coast.
The New England region includes states in the northeastern corner of the United States.
The Plains region includes states in the central United States known for their flat prairies.
The Rocky Mountains region includes states in the western United States with the Rocky Mountain range.
The Southeast region includes states in the southeastern corner of the United States.
The Southwest region includes states in the southwestern United States.
The West region includes states on the western coast of the United States.

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES ACT (CSA) AND DEA REGULATION
regulations_points.regulation_description: The CSA controls certain drugs' manufacturing, import, possession and distribution. DEA implements the CSA and regulates drugs like OTC cough and cold medications containing controlled substances, for instance, codeine.

FDA's Center for Drug Evaluation and Research (CDER) ensures the safety and effectiveness of drugs in the market. New OTC medicines must receive FDA approval through the New Drug Application (NDA) process before they are cleared for marketing.

OTC drugs can also reach the market via OTC monographs, which cover acceptable ingredients, doses, formulations, labeling and sometimes testing parameters. Medicines conforming to a monograph do not require FDA pre-approval.

The process of REMS may cause hindrances in approvals for new drugs. It is a regulatory strategy to manage a known or potentially severe risk associated with a medicine and to ensure the benefits outweigh these risks.

regulations_points.regulation_title: FDA Guidance on COVID-19 Manufacturing Controls
regulations_points.regulation_description: The FDA has issued specific guidelines to prevent contamination of drugs during the pandemic, assess the risk of SARS-CoV-2 on drug safety and quality and maintain manufacturing processes.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The need for high initial capital to invest in advanced technology and machinery presents a significant financial barrier for new entrants to the industry.

basis_points.basis_description: Brand awareness and innovation are key in the cough and cold medicine industry. The competition among OTC medicine manufacturers pivots significantly around brand reputation and product portfolio.

External competition is lower due to high costs and complex production processes. Although substitute products and private-label medicines are present, they can't quite compete on price with OTC drugs due to costly and complex production procedures.

concentration_points.concentration_description: A few major companies dominate the cough and cold medicine manufacturing industry but don't hold a significant percentage because of their diversified business operations in other pharmaceutical sectors.
In the coming years, many cough and cold medicine manufacturers are expected to engage in mergers and acquisitions to expand market share and enhance operational efficiency.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Manufacturers Overcome Rising Costs with Innovation and Efficiency in OTC Medicine Production
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases comprise one of the most significant expenses for the industry, accounting for an estimated 25.8% of industry revenue in 2023. The manufacture of over-the-counter (OTC) cough and cold medications are heavily reliant on procuring raw materials like chemicals, dyes, alcohol and packaging materials.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Shifting Workforce Trends in Cough and Cold Medicine Manufacturing
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages will account for 10.5% of average industry revenue in 2023. The industry sees a growing need for a workforce to perform operational activities like machinery operation, inspection and quality control. The total value of industry-related wages has increased.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: The need for high initial capital to invest in advanced technology and machinery presents a significant financial barrier for new entrants to the industry.
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The need for high initial capital to invest in advanced technology and machinery presents a significant financial barrier for new entrants to the industry.

volatility_points.volatility_title: STEADY PROFITABILITY STEERED BY STABLE DEMOGRAPHICS
volatility_points.volatility_description: The Cough and Cold Medicine Manufacturing OTC industry display low revenue volatility because of shifts in demographic trends in the United States. The number of children aged nine and under, considered the most susceptible to the flu, has not seen a drastic fluctuation in recent decades, resulting in steady demand for over-the-counter (OTC) cough and cold remedies.

volatility_points.volatility_title: SCALING PEAKS AMID SEASONAL WAVES AND GLOBAL PANDEMICS
volatility_points.volatility_description: The demand for cough and cold OTC medicine is seasonal, peaking during the flu season months between December to February. Widespread pandemics, especially those inducing upper-respiratory symptoms like coughing, congestion and fever, can highly alter the domestic demand for the industry's products.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: TABLETS AND PACKETS LEAD THE INDUSTRY
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Tablets are medications in pressed powder, while capsules contain gel or powdered drugs encased in dissolvable shells. The pharmaceutical industry sees its most significant revenue share from tablets and capsules. Notably, recognized brands like Tylenol and Mucinex significantly contribute to this sales category.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: UNRAVELING THE POPULARITY AND FUTURE OF LIQUID POWDERS
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Liquid powders are consumable products – ranging from cough and cold remedies to children's medication – that are dissolved before use. Noteworthy among these is the Theraflu range and Children's Mucinex, which are proving popular for their ease of ingestion compared to tablets.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: COUGH SYRUPS: A PEDIATRIC STAPLE WITH EVOLVING REGULATIONS
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Cough syrups, making a significant proportion of the industry revenue, have found strong demand from parents of children over four due to FDA guidelines restricting over-the-counter cough and cold medicines for children under four.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: THE MARKET TREND AND HEALTH CONCERNS OF NASAL PRODUCTS AND THROAT DROPS
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Nasal products and throat drops, including decongestant nasal sprays and drops, form a significant part of the industry's revenue. These products stimulate adrenergic receptors to reduce swelling and mucus formation in the nose, throat and sinuses.

FAQs.question: How is your company affected by rising imports?
FAQs.answer: Rising imports from European manufacturers are a source of intense competition for domestic manufacturers.

FAQs.question: How much does your company allocate marketing expenses?
FAQs.answer: On average, depending on the size of the company, an average company allocates between 1.0 and 5.0% of total revenue on advertising and promotion.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile input prices over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: The price of plastic and resin products, which are a main component of industry product packaging, can increase purchase costs, thereby constraining profitability.

FAQs.question: Is your company investing heavily in R&D to meet changing consumer preferences?
FAQs.answer: Given the high level of competition in the industry, establishing an edge through increased R&D can benefit a company.

FAQs.question: Do you use SAP software systems to optimize all aspects of your company's manufacturing, sales, inventory and distribution channels?
FAQs.answer: SAP software systems enable a company to streamline and monitor all aspects of the manufacturing process.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs through automation over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Increasing automation, thanks to developing technology, can help to reduce wage costs and operational inefficiencies.

FAQs.question: Have any regulatory expenses significantly impacted profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: Reclassification of certain industry products could potentially impact profitability.

FAQs.question: Do you work with trade associations or other interest groups to advance your company's interests?
FAQs.answer: The Consumer Healthcare Products Association (CHPA) is the largest industry association and is membership based.

FAQs.question: How do your company's profit margins compare to your main competitors'?
FAQs.answer: On average, the industry profit margin, measured as earnings before interest and taxes, is 15.8%.

FAQs.question: How does your company compensate for the seasonality of cash flow?
FAQs.answer: Since products are subject to a high degree of seasonality, a company must diversify its product offerings to maintain steady revenue throughout the year.

FAQs.question: Do any big name companies sell your products? What retailer contracts are you pursuing or have already?
FAQs.answer: Products placed at high-profile outlets are more likely to be noticed and purchased by consumers, leading to higher sales.

FAQs.question: Do you manufacture any branded products? How do you promote your products and services?
FAQs.answer: A reputable brand name is important to marketing success in the competitive branded pharmaceutical business. Drug companies use several criteria in selecting a brand name, including how easy it is to remember and any subliminal connotation of the drug.

FAQs.question: How do you attract repeat customers? Have you been able to leverage product safety to your advantage?
FAQs.answer: Market perceptions of the safety and quality of products are important. If a company receives negative publicity or if any of the company's products or similar products prove to be harmful to consumers, it could have an adverse effect on the company.

FAQs.question: How do you capture consumer demographic data? What can you do to assure parents of your products' safety?
FAQs.answer: Growing consumer wariness regarding the safety of OTC medications for children under the age of four has constrained demand from this demographic.

FAQs.question: How much of your company's revenue is derived from overseas exports? Can you enhance the quality of your products to compete with low-cost imports?
FAQs.answer: As the US dollar appreciates, cough and cold medications from US manufacturers become relatively more expensive for globally based consumers.

FAQs.question: What percentage of your revenue comes from pharmacies and drug stores? What percentage of your products are OTC?
FAQs.answer: Many time-strapped consumers purchase over-the-counter (OTC) cough and cold medications from pharmacies and drug stores, rather than visit their healthcare provider to obtain a prescription medication.
